title: Welcome to Culture Connection
content:
Welcome to Culture Connection!

Our mission is to build community through weekly, non-alcohol events. This guide explains how to run the association under our bylaws.

Address

Pelarplatsen 8
352 52 Växjö, Sweden

Guide Overview

  • Membership & fees
  • Board structure
  • Meetings & elections
  • Committees & communication
  • Finance, events, amendments

title: Membership Management
content:
Membership Management

Who can join: Students, alumni, faculty & community members

Membership Periods

  • Period 1: July–December
  • Period 2: January–June

How to Become a Member

  1. Pay membership fee at start of period
  2. Secretary/Treasurer confirms payment
  3. Issue membership card (physical or digital)
  4. Add to official membership list

Fees are non-refundable and set by the board before each period.

title: Board Structure & Responsibilities
content:
Board Structure & Responsibilities

The board comprises an odd number of officers:

  • President
  • Vice President
  • Treasurer
  • Secretary
  • Social Media Manager
  • Head of Committees
  • Event Director

Core Responsibilities

  • Recruit new members
  • Secure sponsors & grants
  • Develop partnerships aligned with our values

Term: One year. Elections bi-annual. Re-election allowed.

title: Officer Specific Duties
content:
Officer Duties

President

  • Lead the association & preside over meetings
  • Official spokesperson
  • Delegate tasks & sign documents

Vice President

  • Support the President & lead in their absence
  • Implement goals & manage sponsor relations

Treasurer

  • Manage finances & budgets
  • Prepare financial reports & grant proposals
  • Process transactions & reimbursements (board-approved)

Secretary

  • Maintain membership records & meeting minutes
  • Set agendas & handle correspondence

Social Media Manager

  • Manage website & social channels
  • Promote events online

Head of Committees

  • Liaise between committees & board
  • Monitor committee performance

Event Director

  • Plan event logistics & schedule
  • Manage proposals & external promotions

title: Meeting Management
content:
Meeting Management

Member Meetings (Bi-annual)

  • Period 1: October
  • Period 2: March
  • 2 weeks’ notice via social media & print

Purpose

  • Elect officers
  • Review financial reports
  • Discuss progress & issues

Board Meetings

  • Monthly during academic year
  • Emergency meetings with 1 business day’s notice

Voting Rights

Only active members in good standing may vote. Majority rules.

title: Committee Operations
content:
Committee Operations

Standing Committees

Election Committee

  • 3 members (non-board)
  • Oversees bi-annual elections

Special Purpose Committees

  • Design & Media
  • Sponsors & Collaborations
  • Activity Leaders

Roles & Reporting

  • Propose initiatives
  • No board voting rights
  • Report to Head of Committees

title: Financial Management
content:
Financial Management

Fiscal Year

March to March

Budget Process

  1. Treasurer drafts budget
  2. Board reviews & approves
  3. Present at member meetings

Treasurer Duties

  • Maintain transparent records
  • Handle transactions & reimbursements
  • Submit grant proposals
  • Present bi-annual reports

Membership Fees

  • Set by board before each period
  • Non-refundable
  • Payment confirms membership

title: Event Management
content:
Event Management

Planning Process

  1. Submit proposal to Event Director
  2. Check schedule for conflicts
  3. Review alignment with mission
  4. Board approval if required
  5. Promote & execute

Standards & Conduct

  • Non-alcohol events only
  • Inclusive & respectful environment
  • Board may remove disruptive attendees

Scheduling

Weekly events with diverse cultural themes.

title: Communication & Documentation
content:
Communication & Documentation

Secretary

  • Maintain membership list
  • Record meeting minutes
  • Set agendas & handle correspondence

Social Media Manager

  • Maintain online presence
  • Promote events on social platforms
  • Update website

Notifications

  • Member meetings: 2 weeks’ notice
  • Emergency meetings: 1 business day’s notice
  • Use social media & printed flyers

title: Election Process
content:
Election Process

Timeline

  • Bi-annual elections during member meetings
  • One-year terms, re-election allowed

Election Committee

  1. 3 non-board members organize elections
  2. Announce 2 weeks in advance
  3. Accept nominations & conduct vote
  4. Majority vote decides winners

Interim Appointments

  • Board may appoint interim officers
  • Serve until next scheduled election

Voting Eligibility

Active members in good standing only.

title: Amendments & Changes
content:
Amendments & Changes

Proposal

  • Submit ≥1 month before member meeting
  • Include rationale & impact analysis

Adoption

  1. Discuss at member meeting
  2. Majority vote by attendees
  3. Implement approved amendments

Dissolution

  • Founding board vote required
  • Assets transfer to similar non-profit
  • Board selects recipient aligned with mission

title: Best Practices & Tips
content:
Best Practices & Tips

Member Engagement

  • Communicate regularly across channels
  • Encourage active participation
  • Recognize member contributions

Event Success

  • Offer diverse cultural activities
  • Ensure cultural sensitivity
  • Collect & act on feedback

Financial Health

  • Maintain transparent records
  • Diversify funding: fees, grants, sponsors
  • Review budgets regularly

Community Building

  • Bridge international & local communities
  • Create meaningful connections
  • Foster a safe, inclusive environment
